DOC.HEADLINE: PACIFIC WATCH : SINGAPORE
DOC.TEXT: Trade Totals Rise in April : Total trade grew 19.6 % to $ 16.9 billion in April from $ 14.3 billion for that month last year , according to the Singapore Trade Development Board.Total trade volume grew 13 % in April , based on a three-month moving average . Volume of_imports rose 10.6 % , and volume of exports rose 15.6 % . Non-oil domestic exports -- led by higher demand for computer chips , disk_drives , microcomputers and other goods -- grew 16.7 % in volume . Re-exports grew 17.5 % . Weak oil prices pushed the value of exported oil down 13.4 % , although volume rose 8 % .
